column4:
Given relation R(ABCD) with FD set: {B → C, D → A}

[u]Finding key for R[/u]:
	B, D is not there in right hand side of any FD. So find (BD)[sup]+[/sup]
		(BD)[sup]+[/sup] = BCDA
	Therefore BC is the only candidate key of relation R. Prime attributes = {B, C}
	Given FD set
		B → C		----- (1)
		D → A		----- (2)
	FD (1) violates 2NF since it is a partial dependency
	[object]DBMS Subject Test 1/Q25_exp.PNG[/object:224:69:]	 
	∴ The highest normal form that R satisfies is 1NF

FD (1) violates BCNF since LHS of FD (1) i.e., B is not super key
		So, find (B)[sup]+[/sup], (B)[sup]+[/sup] = BC
		 [object]DBMS Subject Test 1/Q26_exp.PNG[/object:296:150:]
	So, the total number of tables = 3
